info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 2 at 8:27PM MDT until June 2 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Denver CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, southwestern Logan.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 827 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... South Platte River, Baymer Creek, Pawnee Creek, Sand Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Spring Creek and Springdale Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sterling, Logan Corners, Atwood, Pawnee Pass and Willard.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING
